alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 1:37PM EST until January 28 at 3:05AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including Irondequoit Creek in Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding will continue along Irondequoit Creek through tonight, especially in Ellison Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM EST, excessive runoff from the rain and snowmelt earlier in the week continues to result in high water along Irondequoit Creek, especially in Ellison Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Low lying areas near Irondequoit Creek in Irondequoit, East Rochester, Fairport, Brighton and Penfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
